conversations.content: No Mere Toy: Part One
＂I want that dragon,＂ the young princess said.
Her innocent eyes locked upon a real dragon that looked identical to her favorite stuffed toy.
The princess belonged to a royal family that had inherited dragon- blood—chosen ones who could form pacts with their kind.
＂Then form your pact,＂ said the knights who guarded her, parting so she could step toward the dragon and hold outstretched her little hand.
When a princess holds out her hand, all kneel before her and offer it a kiss of respect. This is—and has always been—the way of the world.
But the dragon did not do so. Instead, it let out a derisive laugh, whirled around, and vanished into the dark forest beyond.
For a princess born into a world that she could shape according to her whims, the act was an earth-shattering shock.
Her knights panicked, but when they turned to the princess to behold her wrath, they saw a cheerful smile.
＂How funny,＂ was all she said.
From that day on, the princess began climbing the steps to adulthood so she might make the world dance in the palm of her hand—and so she might have that dragon for her own.
War. Politics. Interpersonal relations. She mastered all manner of things, and all were amazed at her growth. Yet the dragon—the one thing she truly cared about—paid her no mind.
The more coolly the dragon treated her, the more she shone out—until finally she had matured into a brilliant gentlewoman in both name and reality.
Everyone believed her wishes would come true when she reached the top of her climb. But what awaited her was a far different scenario—and a dazzling stage that much suited her...
No Mere Toy: Part Two
The princess strove to improve herself so the endearing, toy-like dragon might agree to form a pact with her. And in so doing, she matured into an elegant young woman.
The first to acknowledge whom she had become was not the dragon, but her royal father, who granted her an important post at a key city within the kingdom.
＂You will set off to Raywall tomorrow,＂ said the king. ＂Once there, you are to form a pact with a dragon with all haste.＂
That night, the princess set out alone to the forest where her desired dragon lived and said three words:
＂I have lost.＂
＂I have been ordered to form a pact with a different dragon, and I will grow old and wither away without you ever acknowledging me.＂
The princess stepped toward the dragon and extended her hand. But she did not wait: She drew her face in close and gave the dragon a kiss. ＂Farewell.＂
Light shone forth from the spot where her parting kiss landed. And from this blinding light came a pactstone—proof given form of the pact that had been sealed.
＂Finally,＂ the dragon said as it stretched. ＂I thought you'd never  acknowledge your own purrfectly obvious weakness.＂
That day, the princess learned there were things in the world she could not change through displays of strength and cunning alone.
(I HAVE become strong. See? Like this...)
Several years later, in the Radiant City, Chanzelia, the two looked back on the moment they made their pact.
＂You had meow quite fooled that day, Lady Chelle.＂ ＂Fooled? What a disrespectful thing to say.＂
＂One must use all weapons at their disposal to get what one wants. ...Even a weakness.＂
The powerful princess wore a relaxed smile as her pact dragon and closest partner, Cat Sìth, drew close to her...
